{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3137324,"name":"","username":"Rweaver","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rweaver/{size}/183940_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-01T00:05:58.202Z","cooked":"

We are trying to verify localization with limelight and april tags and are getting errors in our results.

image831×907 46.5 KB

We get tx, ty: (6.18, -2.91). But if the april tag 1 is at position (7.24, -2.94) the camera should be (1.06, -0.03) meters away from the tag (centered in the robot), but we measure our distance from camera to tag as (0.84, -0.10), and error of about 9 inches. Many other measurements are farther off by greater margins the farther away we are from the tag. Are we reading something wrong? Are other teams getting more accurate results? We haven’t found any discussion of limelight localization yet.

How far away can you get before the tag is not detectable at all? What are your capture settings? Higher resolution works better, and if you can get multiple tags in view that’s even better still.

Update to the latest version! It addresses a major accuracy issue present in the version you’re using. Make sure your tag size is set to 152.4mm in the standard tab

Limelight 2023.1 - MegaTag, Performance Boost, My Mistake General Forum
Correcting My Mistake The default marker size parameter in the UI has been corrected to 152.4mm (down from 203.2mm). This was the root of most accuracy issues. My mistake! While it is sometimes acceptable to measure tags by their outermost border, the Limelight interface uses the detection corner distance (black box side length). Increased Tracking Stability There are several ways to tune AprilTag detection and decoding. We’ve improved stability across the board, especially in low light / low…
Limelight 2023.2 - Easier 3D, Neural Net Upload General Forum
Making 3D easier than ever. WPILib-compatible Botposes Botpose is now even easier to use out-of-the-box. New NetworkTables Key “botpose_wpired” - botpose, but with the origin at the right-hand side of the driverstation on the red side of the field. New NetworkTables Key “botpose_wpiblue” - botpose, but with the origin at the right-hand side of the driverstation on the blue side of the field. New Json arrays - botpose_wpired, and botpose_wpiblue All of the above botposes are compatible with …

Are you using targetpose_robotspace from limelight network tables? We also have issues with the localization and pose. Do you create trajectories out of the robot current pose and the targetpose returned by limelight?
